exceptions.tactic: intros X Y HX HY [x y] [x' y'].
intros X' Y HX HY [x y] [x' y'].
intros X' Y' HX HY [x y] [x' y'].

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
Y: Type

Goal:
discrete X -> discrete Y -> discrete (X * Y)

Premises:
discrete = fun X : Type => decidable (fun '(x, y) => x = y) : Type -> Prop Arguments discrete _%type_scope
discrete_bool = let H : forall X : Type, inhabited (eq_dec X) -> discrete X := fun X : Type => match discrete_iff X with | conj _ x0 => x0 end in H bool (inhabits bool_eq_dec) : discrete bool
discrete_nat = let H : forall X : Type, inhabited (eq_dec X) -> discrete X := fun X : Type => match discrete_iff X with | conj _ x0 => x0 end in H nat (inhabits nat_eq_dec) : discrete nat
discrete_nat_nat = let H : forall X : Type, inhabited (eq_dec X) -> discrete X := fun X : Type => match discrete_iff X with | conj _ x0 => x0 end in H (nat * nat)%type (inhabits (prod_eq_dec nat_eq_dec nat_eq_dec)) : discrete (nat * nat)
discrete_iff : forall X : Type, discrete X < -> inhabited (eq_dec X)
prod_eq_dec : forall X Y : Type, eq_dec X -> eq_dec Y -> eq_dec X * Y
decidable = fun (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) => exists f : X -> bool, decider f P : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments decidable {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
ssrfun.tagged2 : forall w : {x : ?I & ?T_ x & ?U_ x}, ?T_ (ssrfun.tag2 w) where ?I : [X : Type Y : Type |- Type] ?T_ : [X : Type Y : Type |- ?I -> Type] ?U_ : [X : Type Y : Type |- ?I -> Type]
ssrfun.tagged2' : forall w : {x : ?I & ?T_ x & ?U_ x}, ?U_ (ssrfun.tag2 w) where ?I : [X : Type Y : Type |- Type] ?T_ : [X : Type Y : Type |- ?I -> Type] ?U_ : [X : Type Y : Type |- ?I -> Type]
ssrfun.Tagged : forall T_ : ?I -> Type, T_ ?i -> {x0 : ?I & T_ x0} where ?I : [X : Type Y : Type |- Type] ?i : [X : Type Y : Type |- ?I]
decidable_iff : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), decidable p < -> inhabited (forall x : X, dec (p x))
dec = fun X : Prop => {X} + {~ X} : Prop -> Type Arguments dec _%type_scope
VectorSpec.uncons_cons : forall (a : ?A) (v : VectorDef.t ?A ?n), VectorDef.uncons (VectorDef.cons ?A a ?n v) = (a, v) where ?A : [X : Type Y : Type |- Type] ?n : [X : Type Y : Type |- nat]
Tauto.clause = fun Term' Annot : Type => list (Term' * Annot) : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.clause (_ _)%type_scope
RingMicromega.NFormula = fun C : Type => (RingMicromega.PolC C * RingMicromega.Op1)%type : Type -> Type Arguments RingMicromega.NFormula _%type_scope
Tauto.cnf = fun Term' Annot : Type => list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.cnf (_ _)%type_scope
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.N {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.I {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope
Inductive prod (A B : Type) : Type := pair : A -> B -> A * B Arguments prod (_ _)%type_scope Arguments pair {A B}%type_scope
Inductive Pol (C : Type) : Type := Pc : C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C | Pinj : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C | PX : Ring_polynom.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C Arguments Ring_polynom.Pol _%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.Pc [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.Pinj [C]%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PX [C]%type_scope _ _%positive_scope
Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : VectorDef.t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n) Arguments VectorDef.t _%type_scope _%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.nil _%type_scope Arguments VectorDef.cons _%type_scope _ _%nat_scope
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Inductive sigT2 (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Type) : Type := existT2 : forall x : A, P x -> Q x -> {x : A & P x & Q x} Arguments sigT2 [A]%type_scope (_ _)%type_scope Arguments existT2 [A]%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Ring_polynom.PNSubstL : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> nat -> nat -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.PSubstL1 : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> nat -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.norm_subst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> nat -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.PSubstL : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> nat -> option (Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Inductive sigT (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) : Type := existT : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A & P x} Arguments sigT [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments existT [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Ring_polynom.PNSubst1 : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> C * Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> nat -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.POneSubst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> C * Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> option (Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Ring_polynom.PNSubst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> C * Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> nat -> option (Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Ring_polynom.MFactor : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> C -> Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Pol C * Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.CFactor : forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C * Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.MPcond : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> list R -> Prop
Inductive sum (A B : Type) : Type := inl : A -> A + B | inr : B -> A + B Arguments sum (_ _)%type_scope Arguments inl {A B}%type_scope, [A] _ _ Arguments inr {A B}%type_scope, _ [B] _
Inductive PExpr (C : Type) : Type := PEO : Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEI : Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEc : C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEX : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEadd : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEsub : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEmul : Ring_polynom.PExpr C ->...-> Ring_polynom.PExpr C Arguments Ring_polynom.PExpr _%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEO {C}%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEI {C}%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEc [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEX _%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEadd [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEsub [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEmul [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEopp [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEpow [C]%type_scope _ _%N_scope
Ring_polynom.mkmultm1 : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R) -> (R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> (R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
Ring_polynom.mkmult1 : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> (R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
Tauto.ror_clause_cnf : forall Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> list (Term' * Annot) -> list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) -> list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) * list Annot
Tauto.xror_clause_cnf : forall Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> list (Term' * Annot) -> list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) -> list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) * list Annot
InitialRing.triv_div : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> C -> C -> C * C

```coq
intros X Y HX HY [x y] [x' y'].
unfold discrete in HX, HY.
apply andb_true_iff in HX.
apply andb_true_iff in HY.
destruct HX as [Heq_x | Hneq_x], HY as [Heq_y | Hneq_y].
- left. apply andb_true_iff. split; congruence.
- right. intros [Hxy | Hnxy].
  + apply Hneq_y. injection Hxy as Hx Hy. congruence.
  + apply Hnxy. congruence.
- right. intros [Hxy | Hnxy].
  + apply Hneq_x. injection Hxy as Hx Hy. congruence.
  + apply Hnxy. congruence.
- right. intros [Hxy | Hnxy].
  + apply Hneq_x. injection Hxy as Hx Hy. congruence.
  + apply Hneq_y. injection Hnxy as Hx' Hy'. congruence.
Qed.
```

original: intros X Y HX HY [x y] [x' y']. unfold discrete in HX, HY. apply andb_true_iff in HX. apply andb_true_iff in HY. destruct HX as [Heq_x | Hneq_x], HY as [Heq_y | Hneq_y]. - left. apply andb_true_iff. split; congruence. - right. intros [Hxy | Hnxy]. + apply Hneq_y. injection Hxy as Hx Hy. congruence. + apply Hnxy. congruence. - right. intros [Hxy | Hnxy]. + apply Hneq_x. injection Hxy as Hx Hy. congruence. + apply Hnxy. congruence. - right. intros [Hxy | Hnxy]. + apply Hneq_x. injection Hxy as Hx Hy. congruence. + apply Hneq_y. injection Hnxy as Hx' Hy'. congruence.
